title: The doubting virgin, and the constant youngman. Observe what here is put in print, all you that do love merriment: it's for young men and maids also, stay and hear't o're before you go. Tune of, The repriev'd captive, by Tobias Brown [sic].
author: Bowne, Tobias.
publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner.,
notes: Verse: "Oh my dearest do not slight me ..."
Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
